news.name: Yankees activate Giancarlo Stanton
news.title: Yankees activate Giancarlo Stanton
news.abstract: The slugging DH had been on the injured list since the beginning of the season, due to elbow injuries.
news.body:
NEW YORK - Giancarlo Stanton is back, and the AL East-leading Yankees' lineup is a little more dangerous.

On the injured list since Opening Day due to what amounted to severe tennis elbow in both elbows, Stanton was activated by the Yankees prior to Monday night's four-game series opener against the Angels.

news.name: PennWest Edinboro announces 2025 Athletic Hall of Fame Class
news.title: PennWest Edinboro announces 2025 Athletic Hall of Fame Class

news.body:
(WJET/WFXP)– Ten former standout Edinboro athletes are being added to the Edinboro Athletic Department Hall of Fame this fall, along with an entire football team.

The 2025 Edinboro Athletics 2025 Hall of Fame Class includes former athletes from softball, wheelchair basketball, women’s basketball, women’s soccer, women’s swimming, and wrestling, while also mark...

news.name: Trump Wins Tariff Reprieve as Trade Agenda Faces Rollback
news.title: Trump Wins Tariff Reprieve as Trade Agenda Faces Rollback
news.abstract: A federal appeals court offered President Donald Trump a temporary reprieve from a ruling threatening to throw out the bulk of h...
news.body:
(Bloomberg) --

A federal appeals court offered President Donald Trump a temporary reprieve from a ruling threatening to throw out the bulk of his sweeping tariff agenda, giving at least some hope to a White House now facing substantial new restrictions on its effort to rewrite the global trading order.

The administration celebrated the order from the US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit as validating its vow t...

news.name: Democrats Slam Hegseth’s Plan to Cut Weapons-Testing Office
news.title: Democrats Slam Hegseth’s Plan to Cut Weapons-Testing Office
news.abstract: The top Democrat on the Senate Armed Services Committee slammed Pentagon plans to slash staffing at the office that oversees tes...
news.body:
(Bloomberg) -- The top Democrat on the Senate Armed Services Committee slammed Pentagon plans to slash staffing at the office that oversees tests of major weapons systems, after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth claimed the cuts would save the government $300 million.

Senator Jack Reed of Rhode Island lamented the cuts to the Office of the Director of Operational Test and Evaluation as “reckless and damaging to military accoun...

news.name: Judge Weighs Big Changes to Google, Including Breakup, AI Limits
news.title: Judge Weighs Big Changes to Google, Including Breakup, AI Limits
news.abstract: The federal judge who will decide how to limit Google’s monopoly in search is considering its advantage in artificial intelligence, and aiming to minimize harm to the other players in the market with any resolution.
news.body: (Bloomberg) -- The federal judge who will decide how to limit Google’s monopoly in search is considering its advantage in artificial intelligence, and aiming to minimize harm to the other players in the market with any resolution.

news.title: Taylor Swift Fans Are Full of Emotions After She Buys Back Her Masters: ‘Taylor ALWAYS Wins'
news.abstract: "I can now go back and listen to all of her original albums and not feel guilty," one fan wrote.
news.body:
Taylor Swift fans are very, very used to the pop star surprising them - but she might have just outdone herself with the announcement that she's purchased back the masters to her first six albums, following an arduous six-year fight to do so.

news.name: Families flock to Churchill Downs to celebrate Father's Day
news.title: Families flock to Churchill Downs to celebrate Father's Day
news.abstract: The racetrack's annual Father's Day celebration drew in large crowds and served as a great way to make memories with dad.
news.body:
Churchill Downs was packed with families Sunday, all coming together to celebrate Father's Day in true Kentucky style with a day at the races.

The racetrack's annual Father's Day celebration drew in large crowds and served as a great way to make memories with dad.

news.body:
Universal's live-action remake "How to Train Your Dragon" took flight at the top of the China box office over the June 13–15 weekend, opening with RMB79.7 million ($11.1 million), according to Artisan Gateway.

news.name: Here Are the Top-Performing Stocks From the S&P 500 This Year
news.title: Here Are the Top-Performing Stocks From the S&P 500 This Year
news.abstract: The stock market has been one heck of a seesaw in 2025. A bit over a month ago, the S&P 500 was down more than 15% on the year a...
news.body:
The stock market has been one heck of a seesaw in 2025.

A bit over a month ago, the S&P 500 was down more than 15% on the year and narrowly avoided an official bear market (in fact, it closed down 19% from its highs and touched bear territory intraday). The Nasdaq officially entered one.

By mid-May, the S&P 500 soared back into the green for 2025. It was the fastest recovery in over 40 years, with the index erasing its 15% year-to-date loss in less than six weeks. It’s a good reminder that on...

news.name: Foreigners claim £1bn a month in benefits
news.title: Foreigners claim £1bn a month in benefits
news.abstract: Benefits claims by households with at least one foreign national have doubled to nearly £1 billion a month in the past three years, government figures show.
news.body:
Benefits claims by households with at least one foreign national have doubled to nearly £1 billion a month in the past three years, government figures show.

Households with at least one claimant who is a foreign national received £941 million in March this year, up from £461 million in March 2022...

news.name: Madison County School System approves $1,000 salary increase for employees
news.title: Madison County School System approves $1,000 salary increase for employees
news.abstract: Madison County School System employees will receive a $1,000 salary increase after board approval.
news.body:
Madison County School System employees will soon see a $1,000 salary increase following approval by the Madison County Board of Education on Friday morning.

The increase was first announced after its approval on May 15, according to the school system.

Superintendent Ken Jubik initiated the recommendation for the raise, which will add an estimated $2.5 million to the district's budget each year.
